messages.title: My personal pledges to you
messages.content:
Honesty, integrity and a peopleâ€™s Parliament
I would like to see a legally-binding code of conduct for MPs. I support a written constitution for the United Kingdom which should be created by the people, not just politicians.
Investment and employment, not immediate cuts
I will oppose cuts which put our economic recovery at risk and punish ordinary people for the recession. Where cuts are needed, I will support 'efficiency savings' which do not adversely affect jobs and services.
Public services not private profit
I will campaign now to maintain investment in health, education and housing. I will also campaign for utilities and the railways to be made more accountable to both customers and passengers.
Banks responsible to society
I want to see banks organised so they deliver real benefits to society rather than just to their shareholders. I will support local credit unions, giving people an alternative to rogue lenders, and action to better regulate banks and hedge funds.
Education for the many not the few
I support a truly comprehensive education system giving our young people a real choice between vocational and academic subjects on the same premises. I will also campaign for lower class sizes.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Honesty, integrity and a people's Parliament
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for a legally-binding code of conduct for MPs and a written constitution created by the people.
Opposition to immediate cuts that harm economic recovery and a focus on efficiency savings that do not adversely affect jobs and services.
Advocacy for continued investment in health, education, and housing, and increased accountability for utilities and railways to customers and passengers.
Promotion of banks that benefit society, support for credit unions as alternatives to 'rogue lenders,' and regulation of banks and hedge funds.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Education for the many not the few
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for a comprehensive education system offering both vocational and academic choices and smaller class sizes.

issues.education: Support for a truly comprehensive education system giving our young people a real choice between vocational and academic subjects on the same premises. Campaign for lower class sizes.
issues.governance: Support for a legally-binding code of conduct for MPs and a written constitution created by the people.
issues.health: Campaign to maintain investment in health.

housing.content: Campaign now to maintain investment in... housing.

endorsements.endorsement: Free travel on buses, free television viewing, Winter Fuel Payments: All thanks to Gordon Brown. Don't vote for change!
